content.question:
Ilioneus praises the missing Aeneas.

“Rex erat Aeneas nobis, quo iustior alter1

nec pietate fuit, nec bello maior et armis.

Quem si fata virum servant, si vescitur2 aura

aetheria neque adhuc3 crudelibus occubat4 umbris,

(5) non metus.”5

1alter, altera, alterum, adj.: other, another person, anyone else

2vescor, vesci + abl.: feed upon

3adhuc, adv.: yet, already

4occubo, -are: lie dead

5supply est nobis with metus

Aeneid 1. 544-548

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
